alert.note: Alert for Trumbull (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued February 17 at 10:49PM EST until February 19 at 8:12AM EST by NWS Cleveland
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Ohio... Cuyahoga River At Independence affecting Cuyahoga County. Cuyahoga River At Old Portage affecting Summit County. Eagle Creek Above Findlay affecting Hancock County. Eagle Creek At Phalanx Station affecting Trumbull County. ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Ohio... Portage River At Woodville affecting Sandusky and Wood Counties. Sandusky River At Tiffin affecting Seneca County. Huron River Near Milan affecting Erie County. Black River At Elyria affecting Lorain County. Chagrin River At Willoughby affecting Lake County. Grand River At Painesville affecting Lake County. Blanchard River Near Findlay affecting Hancock County. Nimishillen Creek Near North Industry affecting Stark County. Mahoning River At Youngstown affecting Mahoning and Trumbull Counties. Mahoning River At Warren affecting Trumbull County. Mahoning River At Leavittsburg affecting Trumbull County. Scioto River Near Larue affecting Marion County. Maumee River At Waterville affecting Wood and Lucas Counties. Killbuck Creek Near Killbuck affecting Holmes and Wayne Counties. For the Portage River...including Woodville...Minor flooding is forecast. For the Sandusky River...including Fremont, Upper Sandusky, Tiffin, Bucyrus...Minor flooding is forecast. For the Huron River...including Milan...Minor flooding is forecast. For the Black River...including Elyria...Minor flooding is forecast. For the Cuyahoga River...including Old Portage, Independence... Moderate flooding is forecast. For the Chagrin River...including Willoughby...Minor flooding is forecast. For the Grand River...including Painesville...Minor flooding is forecast. For the Blanchard River...including Findlay...Moderate flooding is forecast. For the Scioto River...including Larue, Prospect...Minor flooding is forecast. For the Killbuck Creek...including Killbuck...Moderate flooding is forecast. For the Mahoning River...including Leavittsburg, Warren, Youngstown...Major flooding is forecast. For the Site Specific Non-forecast Pt...including Phalanx Station, Findlay...Moderate flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL SATURDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Major flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Mahoning River At Warren. * WHEN...Until Saturday morning. * IMPACTS...At 12.5 feet, Southern portions of South Park Avenue, Civitella Streets, and Pine Avenues flooded. Berkins Park inundated. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 10:30 PM EST Thursday the stage was 7.7 feet. - Forecast...The river will rise above flood stage just after midnight tonight to 12.5 feet early tomorrow afternoon. It will then fall below flood stage early Saturday morning to 6.3 feet and begin rising again Saturday evening. It will rise to 6.5 feet early Sunday morning. It will then fall to 5.9 feet and begin rising again Sunday evening. It will rise to 6.4 feet early Monday morning. It will then fall again and remain below flood stage. - Flood stage is 10.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 12.0 feet on 02/07/2008. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued Friday morning by 1100 AM EST.
